Solved the "Insert DVD problem"!

All it needed was a no-CD crack. A quick trip to gamecopyworld.com and a bit of browsing got me the proper crack. Open folder, take the setup.exe, and overwrite the same file in the game's program data. You guys know the drill.

This site should take you to the crack. Hope this helps!

http://dl.gamecopyworld.com/?d=2008&f=vty-0166!rar
Oh, and I forgot to thank the uploader. Terriffic torrent, it's working great for me. No save-game issues, no crashes. Thanks a million!

How-to make it work (on XP):

- mount GEARSOFWAR.B6T with daemon tools
- install the game
- get a nocd at gamecopyworld
- put the date time to year 2006
- play the game

English only

HTH
totobol

How-to make it work (tested on XP 32bits):

- mount GEARSOFWAR.B6T with daemon tools
- install the game
- install patch #3 (latest patch)
  In case of forcing a bios update (some ASUS motherboards): 
    do not update your bios, its not needed and useless:
    move temporarely your C:\Program Files\ASUS\ASUSUpdate directory to desktop before installing the patch
    (put it back to C:\Program Files\ASUS\ when patching is done)
- get a nocd 1.2 at gamecopyworld and install it
- put the date time to year 2006 : nomore needed!
- play the game

- during game: double tap movement key to go into cover

Your progression is actually saved (fortunately)
English only

HTH

To resolve this problem, follow these steps:

   1. Uninstall Gears of War from your computer.
   2. After Gears of War is uninstalled, delete any Gears of War files or folders that remain on the system.
   3. Reinstall Gears of War from the DVD.
   4. After Gears of War is successfully installed, make sure that you do not start the game.
   5. Visit the following Microsoft Web site to download the latest Games of War update:
http://download.microsoft.com/download/5/1/A/51A3F34C-E65D-47D1-9E28-02E3356FEC3F/GearsPC_TU3_Microsoft.exe (http://download.microsoft.com/download/5/1/A/51A3F34C-E65D-47D1-9E28-02E3356FEC3F/GearsPC_TU3_Microsoft.exe)
      Note You can also obtain the latest update from the following Gears of War Web site:
http://gearsofwar.xbox.com/pc/qfe1.htm (http://gearsofwar.xbox.com/pc/qfe1.htm)
   6. Save the download to your Desktop.
   7. When the download is complete, close the Windows Internet Explorer browser, and then view your Desktop.
   8. Double-click the executable file that was downloaded to your computer. The English version is called "GearsPC_TU3_Microsoft."
   9. After the update is complete, start Gears of War.

Now, you should be able to successfully start and play Gears of War.

to anyone that does not have the play button when you start the game:press the start button type in run in the search box then in that window type regedit then delete the "folder" of the SYMBOL L, just before the 0
[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Curre ntVersion\Internet Settings\Zones\L] THIS IS THE WAY TO FIX THIS PROBLEM!!

Also for anyone having trouble.

I am running OS Win 7 Home Premium.

>Mount Gears of War RAZOR.iso
  (I use Daemon Tools to mount my images)

>Your computer should automatically open up setup, click install.

> When done installing, open computer and right click on your CD Drive and open.

>Open Razor folder. Take out the Startup.exe and put it inside the Binaries folder of where you chose to install your game.

Default C:/Program Files/Microsoft Games/ Gears of War/ Binaries

Replace and delete the original startup.exe with the cracked one.
